props.text: On Sunday, David decided he would go and see his parents who lived in Oxford.
They wanted to leave early to avoid the crowds, so they got up at half past six...
By seven o'clock, they were ready. They got into the car and set off.
Have you got everything?
Of course I have.
I'm sure we've forgotten something.
No, the presents are on the back seat and the book Dad wanted is here,
our over-night bag is in the boot - what could we forgotten?
Have you notified your parents about the visit?
Nope, it's a surprise!
Have I got everything?
Have I got everything?
Have I got everything?
I forgot to fill the tank before leaving. We drive to petrol station first.
You said we had forgotten something and you were right.
Have I?
I rang Dad last night and told him we would arrive at about ten.
How far to go?
Only another fifty miles. We'll be there in an hour.
Damn! I know what I forgot. I forgot to fill the tank before leaving.
Suddenly, the motor coughed and the car began to slow down.
Fortunately, they could continue their journey.
I'm sorry, love, I should have listened to you,
you said we had forgotten something and you were right.
Yes, it's silly to run out of petrol on the motorway. You ought to have checked before.
They took the motorway and were soon driving quickly towards Oxford.
How can I help my parents in this difficult situation?
What... What can I do?

"Mobile Network Not Available"
:(

Gimme fuel,
Gimme fire,
Gimme that which I desire,
Ooh!

Oh son, you saved us!
I remember now!
There is a can of petrol in the boot!

Good job, Thomas.
You hit the nail on the head!
They continued their journey.
What's inside this box, Mom?
It's a gift for grandma.
But what's inside of it?
Actually nothing. It's just an old box. I found this one in the attic.
We have no money for a good gift for now.
Yesterday our cat was pre-approved for  another credit card.
Ha-ha-ha-ha!
So we would buy something better for the next visit.
Oxford looked very beautiful that morning. It is not for nothing that it is called "The city of Sprites".
Wow!
David hasn't told his parents about the meeting but his father greeted them at the door.
Surprise!

Surprise???
Ha-ha! I've read about your visit on Twitter.
You tweet like a teenager, David!
Is this @bigboy777 follower is my dad?
Your phone calls are rare, so we decided to look after you on Twitter.

Oh, Thomas. Apple of my eye!
You look well. Everybody come in!
Hi grandpa!
David told his parents about the meeting. His father greeted them at the door.
Did you have a good trip?
Er, yes thanks, it was alright.
Put your bags down and come here.
It's just a little something I found in a junk... I mean, in an antique shop.
Oh, it's lovely! But what is it?
Well. it's Victorian. It's a... thing.
I think I'll put my earrings in it!
Here is a small present for you.
Oh, I'm off the hook!
What to say?
No, we didn't.
I forgot to fill the tank and we ran out of fuel on the road.
Thomas saved us!

It's in your usual style, David!
:))
Good boy!
What to answer?
props.ans2: I found it in a junk

props.text: It's just a little something I found in a junk...
This looks very expensive!
If I tell the truth Grandma may get angry... I don't want to get any problems in the family.
props.ans1: Say that the box is antique
props.ans2: Say that the box is just old

props.text:
This is the end of the story.
Now let's check your understanding of it!

The family was traveling to Oxford by car.
Is it true?
There was enough fuel in the tank to get to Oxford when the family left the house.
What was inside the box that was gifted to grandma?
Grandma decided to put earrings to the box. But the box was empty.
0 out of 3. That's fail!
1 out of 3. Not bad.
2 out of 3. Good.
3 out of 3. Perfect!
